3 + 1 *G (

) Some authors (e.g.
Jackman et al . 1999
;
Poe 2004
) prefer to place all “anole” lizards, including the next three genera below, into a single genus,
Anolis
( sensu lato ). We prefer to continue recognition of these taxa as phylogenies in the cited papers confirm that each constitutes a well-supported monophyletic group of species.
Ctenonotus Fitzinger, 1843
(
1
)

*

Norops carpenteri (A. A. Echelle, A. F. Echelle & Fitch, 1971 )
( 469 )
The following species was originally based on specimens from western Panama , but Köhler and

Hulebak and Poe ( 2006 )
synonymized
Norops pandoensis Savage & Guyer
, “ 1998 ”, 1999 recognized

as valid by
Savage ( 2002 )
with the following species:

We recognize as distinct the following species, included in
Norops humilis
by
Savage ( 2002 )
, because

the diagnositic characters provided by
Taylor ( 1956 )
for
Anolis humilis marsupialis
amply distinguish

it as a distinct taxon from
N. humilis
and
N. quaggalus
as recently redescribed by
Köhler et al. ( 2003 )
:

The following species, included in
Norops humilis
by
Savage ( 2002 )
, was removed from synonymy

The following species was recently collected (

-20553) in the area near Limón:
